reviews.text: This hotel is clean with nice rooms and friendly staff! Was so nice to stay here after the hustle of Kochin. Really felt relaxed and cosy in the room. A friend also had a room there but wanted to go to a more expensive place for 1 night as a treat to herself - in the end, she wished she had stayed at J.J.s as it was much nicer!! I will stay here again if I go to Munnar.
reviews.title: relaxed stay
Great stay
reviews.text: Stayed here w two frinds. Rooms were nice and clean. Great price and the owners are very friendly. We even managed to play some street cricket w their young son and his friends!

Just we came back from our Munnar trip. JJ cottage is a very clean & neat place. We stayed in top room @ Rs. 800/-. There was 24 hour hot water in a neat & clean bathroom, a huge bed, TV with a couple of English language channels. The view from the room is some big Eucalyptus trees, KSRTC bus stand, tea gardens on top of mountain. The place is located in Old Munnar, and you can walk to several restaurants near by. The family were nice and friendly. The price may not high compared to the size of the room and views. They serve coffee or tea only. They gave one Mahindra Verito car driver number Mr. Johnson( +919846852336), who is a sincere and safe driver in ghat roads. We engaged him for our 4 days trip.
reviews.title: Excellent Budget stay
Spotlessly clean, very comfy
reviews.text: JJ cottage is so far one of the cleanest places I have stayed in in India. There was 24 hour hot water in a sparklingly clean bathroom, a huge bed, TV with a couple of English language channels, clean nice rug. The view wasnt anything special, just onto another building. The place is located in Old Munnar, and you can walk to several restaurants. The family were nice and friendly, and the boy working there, Vijay I think his name was, is friendly and efficient. The price was at the higher end of the budget hotels and you can find cheaper places to stay but maybe the rooms arent as clean or comfortable as this place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: J.J. Cottage was such a beautiful experience and stay. The family that runs the accommodation make you feel right at home and are so helpful. The price is so cheap and you get so much for what you pay for, nice spacious clean room with tv and the hottest water that I have experienced in India, it reminded me just of home. It was piping hot. I was sick for the first 2 nights of arriving in Munnar and the family didnt everything they could to make sure I was comfortable, tell my wife where the best pharmacy was, buy offering their kitchen to cook toast and make tea. Anything that was asked for was always delivered with a friendly smile and they were generally concerned about me. Thank you so much for your wonderful hospitality and everything that you did for me. I'll be sure to recommend J.J cottage to everyone I met and cant wait to visit them again.
reviews.title: Cant wait to go back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We'd booked ahead at JJ Cottage and had been told that there were a choice of rooms available, but when we turned up, we had to wait 45 minutes for "our room" to be cleaned. This turned out to be the most expensive room at the top. This room was rather odd, almost like a conservatory perched on top of the hotel. The walls were glass, and you had to ensure all the curtains were drawn so nobody could peek in. The decor was odd - tiles with cowboys on them and the like. We found it cold and noisy due to the rain, and didn't sleep well because it felt like we were in a fishbowl.
reviews.title: Clean but there's not much to be gained from staying in the town

reviews.text: It was a very clean hotel, and probably the cheaper rooms were less unusual and are better value, but we never got a chance to make a choice.
reviews.title: a perfect de stress spot if u did long travel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was ok if you wanted to stay near the town, but there's not much to do in the evening there, so you might be better off staying in a homestay where it's more relaxing in the evenings.
reviews.title: Very, very kind host

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Its not exactly a cottage. but it did not disappoint me at all since the management is very warm and friendly. I loved my room. Spotless clean room n toilet. Smells great too. I cant remember anything unpleasant abt the stay. The lodge is not too near to the town center, but I think thats the best side of it not being in the noisy area. Value for my money.
reviews.title: Amazing Munnar & JJ Cottage

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights at JJ Cottage for our first visit in Munnar.
reviews.title: lovely hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: JJ Cottages is an excellent place to stay in Munnar. It's not in the center of town but only a Rs 20 (20p) rickshaw ride out which takes no more than 5 mins. You could probably walk it in about 15-20 minutes.
reviews.title: Loved this place...

reviews.text: JJ Cottages is only a few minutes walk away from the bus station which is perfect for coming to / leaving from Munnar. It's also only a 5 minute walk from the DTPC (tourist office) from which a tour of Munnar and surrounding areas departs every morning.
reviews.title: Excellent budget stay

reviews.text: We took a large double room which was lovely and cozy, clean, had a great view and was very spacious for only Rs 750 a night. The owner was so kind and welcomed us into his home to check in / pay the bills, you literally sit in his living room with his kids to fill out the check in book.
reviews.title: Cosy and Clean.

reviews.text: Make sure you wrap up warm for Munnar - it's chilly compared to the rest of India!
reviews.title: Never ask for any services

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Place is in the town, very clean and one of the best budget stay in Munnar.
reviews.title: Good value for a budget Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: JJ Cottage was a great place to stay, in fact we were so comfy we stayed 8 days. We had the top room which was larger than the others and had a great view, sill a great price. Very warm and cosy beds, wonderful hot water, and quiet yet with interesting day to day activity in the street below. Very warm and helpful owners. Ask about the Bison Valley Road walk, it is great!
reviews.title: Cosy and comfortable in Munnar

reviews.text: I stayed two nights in November 2011, my room was clean comfortable and had that rarest of luxuries in India endless hot water. The property is a basic budget venue but very comfortable, situated conveniently close to the bus station. The owners are helpful and obliging and the hotel is a comfortable and very economic base for touring the area. Accomodation is expensive in Munnar and JJs is incredible value for money.
reviews.title: Cheap and Cosy in Munnar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great Hotel based just outside of the main town and depending on room you will get "some" views of the tea plantations. Room had bih#ggest bed we have seen, cable tv and hot water. They had extensive book exchange including guidebooks. Owners were friendly and arranged a rickshaw for full day tour of tea plantations, factory, dam, hill station which was fantastic! It was everything in one trip and only 800 rupees. We would definately recommend this hotel. Many thanks
reviews.title: Magnificent Munnar

reviews.text: We had a reservation and after a long and arduous journey to the frightfully busy Munnar, we arrived to find our room was given to somebody else. The reason, they shouted, was because we didn't arrive by 5pm and as we "haven't pay a rupee", why would we expect to still have our room. We actually rang that morning to double confirm the booking but alas, this agreement was reneaged. They then tried to send us to their next door neighbour who was charging double and only had hot water for three hours per day. We then had to wander the streets with our luggage at night to find somewhere else. They insisted, in an overly aggressive way, that the problem was not their's but our's as we didn't make the deadline (we had no prior knowledge of any deadline) and did nothing to solve the issue. The place looked terrible anyway so I actually think we got lucky. It was the last thing you need after a long trip. Stay at the nearby smm cottage. Much better and friendlier.
reviews.title: DO NOT STAY HERE!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Delightful budget hotel in the lower part of Old Munnar, just off the busy main street. Wonderful family who manages and assists with all your transport and tour needs. We had the big, bright 2nd floor room with a super bed and extra seating, very nice. The TV is very small, poor channel selections, but getting out of the room is probably your main goal as a tourist to Munnar. Just behind is a 4* with good buffet meals. Down the street don't miss the SN Restaurant for dependable Indian food. You can just walk up the little street and head up into a tea plantation for a delightful stroll, just beautiful. The hotel looks out into the valley and neighboring hills.
reviews.title: Great Budget Stay
